column4: hi - I am getting a strange error - I thought I had it figured out, but then I got this.  My problem is that I have no TV-output - it is scrambled.  I know now that it is because it set to PAL, but I can't change it.  I go to ATI control in KDE and I get the following error:
Fire GL Control.  Driver does not provide the FireGL X11 extensions! Panel components will operate only partially.
thats a driver issue you need to find the appropriate documentation for ati
you need to find the appropriate documentation from ati on how their binary driver works and what the appropriate config options would be for x11
if it doesn't work.. go back to win xp..
you have to use what works for you right??
yeah, but it sucks.  I REALLY like ubuntu
ati video cards aren't cutting edge at least not in the context of linux
there is probably nothing in that machine linux can't currently handle.. not even your video card
well thats not good.. one could reverse engineer that stuff but its 2005.. why waste the time
